issue.title: InitError() doesn't always halt node startup when blockchain state exists
issue.body:
As described in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33231#discussion_r2305592114, when `InitError()` is triggered during initialization, the node prints the error but sometimes continues running, if blockchain data already exists in the datadir.

```bash
rm -rfd demo build && mkdir -p demo && cmake -B build && cmake --build build -j$(nproc)
# empty state fails with error
build/bin/bitcoind -datadir=demo -stopatheight=100 -i2psam=invalid_addr
# init state with 10 blocks
build/bin/bitcoind -datadir=demo -stopatheight=1000
# error is shown but doesn't stop execution
build/bin/bitcoind -datadir=demo -i2psam=invalid_addr
```

events.body: I can't reproduce this locally, but I guess you are referring to the `initload` thread doing its work? If yes, I presume the only fix would be to validate the args before starting the initload thread?
